title: We need some progression
body: What riot should do is stop making new champs for a while and let some of the older champs age..... like instead of just doing reworks why not let the champs grow and reveal some additional lore. I mean shouldn't Annie be a bit tall with more experience after 6 years, come on riot.

replies.body:
Letting the champs grow sounds kinda terrible.I mean Annies whole appeal comes from the fact that she is this creepy child.
Making her grow up would kinda ruin it.

Not to mention that by that logic we'll be eventually stuck in the league of grandpas &grandmas....


Also I doubt they'll stop making champs,that is one of the big sellingpoints for lol,that its cast is always expanding.(Not to mention that it probably wouldn't speed up the lore that much).

Though I agree that we should see some progression in the stories for the different champs.

I think we should do both.

Though I'm not keen on aging Annie any time soon.

> Though I'm not keen on aging Annie any time soon.

I was under the assumption that once a champion joined the League, they were kind of locked in at that point in time.  Still able to live day-to-day lives, but upon being summoned they were summoned in the same form as they were locked in as.  Whether or not that allowed champs to age outside of the League is the only thing I couldn't even guess at.  Well, with all the confusion with the lore currently, who knows how things will turn out?
Thast the point, what the fck is in lore anymore?
idk, but apparently we're gonna see some huge lore updates/changes/implementations within a month or so.

It isn't a persistent world, though.  It's basically a moment of time we're playing this game in.  We're not going to have champions dying when they get too old or champions who are young age. 

I really don't want a champion's personality to change at all, that would just mean what we originally liked about them could change at any given moment, making us not like them anymore.

> I really don't want a champion's personality to change at all, that would just mean what we originally liked about them could change at any given moment, making us not like them anymore.

You mean like they've already done to Skarner? He used to have personality and a real story, albeit sorta cliche'd and cheesy story, but one none-the-less. Now he's just a random killing machine monster that kills anything within his radius in the Shurima Desert, that's it. 
Let's face it, they've already thrown all the old lore out the window and admitted they're going to basically change everything. How do you think Lee Sin's personality as a failed summoner is going to last when they REMOVED summoners and the League?

So if you actually expect them to keep true to the old champions personalities then maybe you should come out of the optimist bubble sooner than later, as it's just going to be worse later. xD
